TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Articles.Content:
> 
> I am now angry at the KSP Forum Mods. Why do you have to spread rep around before giving to the same person again?!? WHY??? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Lol ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> I am now angry at the KSP Forum Mods. Why do you have to spread rep around before giving to the same person again?!? WHY??? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

I mean, I see the reason for it, but there are some times when one simply must give MOAR REP. I'll go to the Spacecraft Exchange and be back here in 10 minutes.

Awesome work blackrack.

so I'm having this problem with Scatterer, any idea ? also I'm using Astronomer visual pack, any chance of compatibility problems ?

![5ab33aa3ce.jpg](http://puu.sh/iXBIQ/5ab33aa3ce.jpg)

> 
> so I'm having this problem with Scatterer, any idea ? also I'm using Astronomer visual pack, any chance of compatibility problems ?
> [http://puu.sh/iXBIQ/5ab33aa3ce.jpg](http://puu.sh/iXBIQ/5ab33aa3ce.jpg)

looks like you might be using OpenGL

I completely understand if its just not compatible, but is there any way to get this working under linux with intel graphics? whenever I have it installed the sunsets look nice but there is no scattering going on whatsoever.

Another thought here. Are you sure it is indeed not working? For instance I run win 7 x64 so I try not to inundate the devs with complaints, but.... I need to zoom all the way out into orbit, then back into a ship that's in atmosphere to get Scatterer to run. Upon loading a craft the atmosphere is unchanged until I zoom out and back in.

> 
> Try it without any other mods installed, make a backup etc etc. Some people reported it works fine on intel integrated graphics.

Although under Linux we have no choice other than using OpenGL, so there's that... and here's hoping we'll one day be able to use this beauty of a mod on our OS ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
We can, but we have do disable anisotropic filtering to get rid of the worst side effects, and that comes with it's own set of impairments in visual quality.
Why do you guy "need" to run opengl? Is DX11 not a viable option? I don't run either myself, I'm on Win 7 x64 so forgive my ignorance?
DX is Microsoft only. Hence why it is not available on Unix style platforms.

> 
> DX is Microsoft only. Hence why it is not available on Unix style platforms.

Oh! Ok thanks for the clarification. I have no experience with Linux so there is a lot I don't know at that end of the spectrum.

Argh I installed Kopernicus with its EVE and planetshine profiles, but it shot my FPS so I uninstalled it and placed my backup EVE installs etc back and now the cloud flickering from orbit has reappeared.

No Idea how to fix it since I fixed it by changing the post processing alpha to 78 like that guys screenshots, but it's still set as that now but still does it.

Hello everyone,

is anyone know the release date of the new version of scatterer ?

> 
> Hello everyone,
> is anyone know the release date of the new version of scatterer ?

When Blackrack is satisfied with it. Remember, modders are volunteers doing this in their free time.

I play KSP on both my Linux laptop and on my Windows desktop. I expect some of the graphics glitches in the Linux version due to OpenGL, but I'm running into one weird graphics bug plaguing me on both the linux and windows versions. I do apologize if this has been posted on the thread before, I couldn't really think of what to search for. Not sure if this is related to scatterer but I couldn't think of another mod that I have that'd be capable of causing this.

Most visible when rotating the view in map mode or after an extended period of playtime. Ghosting of the atmosphere, more or less.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/c0Fpl)

known issue, supposedly fixed in the next release but map view does occasionally get borked even on Direct X with the current release.
Cool beans. Thanks for the heads up! Also sorry for not back-reading through the posts :\

> 
> Hello everyone,
> is anyone know the release date of the new version of scatterer ?

Next version is almost ready, all the big features are working great and the major bugs are fixed. I still want to fix a few minor bugs and do some more testing before releasing it to avoid repeating the fiasco that happened last time. I'm a little swamped at work so probably won't work on it before the week-end.

> 
> I play KSP on both my Linux laptop and on my Windows desktop. I expect some of the graphics glitches in the Linux version due to OpenGL, but I'm running into one weird graphics bug plaguing me on both the linux and windows versions. I do apologize if this has been posted on the thread before, I couldn't really think of what to search for. Not sure if this is related to scatterer but I couldn't think of another mod that I have that'd be capable of causing this.
> Most visible when rotating the view in map mode or after an extended period of playtime. Ghosting of the atmosphere, more or less.
> 
> [http://imgur.com/a/c0Fpl](http://imgur.com/a/c0Fpl)

This is already fixed and will be released along with next version. Although I have to warn you, next version breaks OpenGL and dx11 right now. In the best case expect a week between the next version launch and OpenGL getting back to a working state.

> 
> This is already fixed and will be released along with next version. Although I have to warn you, next version breaks OpenGL and dx11 right now. In the best case expect a week between the next version launch and OpenGL getting back to a working state.

Thanks for the hard work! No problem there, I play more on my Win8.1 desktop than on my linux laptop anyway... And I'm patient ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I might be wrong but doesn't KSP default to DX9 anyway?

I love this mod, but i can't use it on Mac, crash overtime now. Not even a take off.

But i hope for future updates...

![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Next version is almost ready, all the big features are working great and the major bugs are fixed. I still want to fix a few minor bugs and do some more testing before releasing it to avoid repeating the fiasco that happened last time. I'm a little swamped at work so probably won't work on it before the week-end.

It's to your credit to want to issue a clean version but do not get too worried, it's a wip. Personally for 0.01 release, I haven't felt like a fiasco.

But if you're swamped at work, take your time and enjoy evenings of the summer!![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

> 
> I might be wrong but doesn't KSP default to DX9 anyway?

Yeah but lots of people play in OpenGL for the lowered RAM usage or because they're on linux.

> 
> It's to your credit to want to issue a clean version but do not get too worried, it's a wip. Personally for 0.01 release, I haven't felt like a fiasco.
> But if you're swamped at work, take your time and enjoy evenings of the summer!![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

Thanks, I was actually talking about the last version where people wouldn't stop reporting the pink objects and the map bugs.

> 
> Thanks, I was actually talking about the last version where people wouldn't stop reporting the pink objects and the map bugs.

I understand what you talking, but I think it's more a comunication question and so if all bugs are in a proper list as is now the case in your first post of your thread, you'll be less bothered by that. Maybe small pics to illustrate the bugs in question could be beneficial.

It still requires additional time but maybe it will save it. In this way, the community could help you to test your releases.

Personally, if I can help you I will be delighted!

> 
> I understand what you talking, but I think it's more a comunication question and so if all bugs are in a proper list as is now the case in your first post of your thread, you'll be less bothered by that. Maybe small pics to illustrate the bugs in question could be beneficial.
> It still requires additional time but maybe it will save it. In this way, the community could help you to test your releases.

I understand, I just want to get the obvious bugs out of the way, so discussion and rare bug reports in the thread don't get buried under a bunch of the same posts.
